result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Clapper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $268.00 payable during the term of supervision in 14CF38

Must serve 4 months. Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician. Absolute sobriety is required. May serve in Walworth County. 2 months are stayed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Clapper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Robert A Clapper in court with attorney John M. Murphy.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. The State indicates there are no Ch. 950 issues and neither party has any additions or corrections. The State recommends Ct 1 in 14CF38 - 3 yrs WPS equal bifurcation/STAYED and in 14CF767, 60 mos RCJ, serve 4 mos, stay 2 mos. No alc/cs-UA's, FT emp and other approp conditions. Defense is in agreement with the recommendation of the State and asks that deft be able to serve his jail time in Walworth County.

BTC: 14CF38, Ct 1-Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS equal bifurcation - STAYED. 3 yrs probation
         14CF767, Ct 2-6 mos RCJ - serve 4 mos/CFTS, 2 are stayed. Huber is granted for employment and may serve in Walworth County
             REPORT IN 11-15-2014 by 8:30 am
            Do not report late or under the influence of alc/cs unless by Rx. Absolute sobriety is required.

Conditions:
obey all rules and regulations
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA treatment, counseling and aftercare
FT emp
Do not associate with any known any illegal substance users

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and ERP
Sentencing hearing on October 13, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Robert A Clapper in court with attorney John M. Murphy.  Sharon A. Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.
State's offer and recommendation.  Plea to Poss w/i Ct 1 in 14CF38 and ct 2 BJ in 14CF767; 3 yrs i/s, (18/18), 3 yrs probation,  6 mos RCJ on BJ charge.  Balance of cts to be d/ri
Court colloquy re rights being waived by entry of plea.  Defendant stipulates to understanding those rights.
State consents to jury waiver
PLEA -- guilty, both counts
Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly and voluntarily.
BTC: finding of guilt, PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-13-2014 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on August 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert A Clapper in court with attorney John Murphy.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
